intro: Litosanthes gracilis, commonly known as the slender rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are clustered in small heads. Litosanthes gracilis is often found in coastal and inland regions, adapting well to arid and semi-arid climates.
